page.title: 20HISTORICAL BUILDINGS
page.content: The ruins of St.Andrews Church lie just at the entrance to the village of Gullane.It was built in the 12th Century, renovated in the 15th Century and fell into disuse around 1600 when it became so overblown with sand that it was deemed unsuitable as a place fit for worship. The Smithy was probably built in the 16th century but nobody is sure.A story told in the village certainly illustrates the Smithy's existence in the 17th Century, it is said that Oliver Cromwell had his horse shod there. Saltcoats Castle, now in ruins, was built in the late 16th Century.It is said to have been built for the Livington family in return for having destroyed a wild boar which was ravaging the district.
